p: ARDS is the most common medical complication seen with SARS-CoV-2, and it contributes to a significant amount of the morbidity and mortality associated with the illness. Therefore, it is considered the hallmark immune-mediated clinical consequence [ 15]. Other complications include shock, acute kidney injury, acute cardiac injury, liver dysfunction, coagulopathy, infection, and even thrombotic disease in otherwise low-risk patients [ 17- 19]. The proportion of patients experiencing each of these complications has been outlined in Table 1. These complications are experienced at higher proportions among severe SARS-CoV-2 cases and therefore serve as major contributors to both intensive care unit (ICU) admission and overall mortality [ 17- 19].
